What are the COVID-19 mutations/variants everyone has been hearing of? How do they differ? What are the 'variants of concern' epidemiologists speak of?

Check our infographic below, and read some more here in our recent risk assessment: https://t.co/IBJaYRaGWN https://t.co/oorMFlLyhc

We are monitoring the evolution of the virus closely and focus on the mutations that may be of a higher risk to the people - calling them the 'variants of concern'.

https://t.co/IBJaYRaGWN

While most of the mutations will not have a significant impact on the danger the virus poses to us, some may give it an advantage  - boosting its transmissibility or the ability to evade our immune response.

Check the latest updates on our dedicated page:
https://t.co/TE7KD96Va2
Viruses constantly change through mutation (they evolve and adapt). This applies also to the #SARSCoV2 virus, causing #COVID19. https://t.co/773l13vpBL

urls.title: Overview of the implementation of COVID-19 vaccination strategies and deployment plans in the EU/EEA
urls.description: This report provides an updated overview of the progress of national COVID-19 vaccination strategies in EU/EEA countries, including updates on: vaccine uptake overall and by target group; vaccination strategies and policies in place; vaccine acceptance and hesitancy; and challenges countries face with increasing uptake and good practices to mitigate these challenges.

#NPIs in schools - #PhysicalDistancing preventing crowding, #hygiene & safety measures are essential to preventing transmission.

#COVID19 https://t.co/yg91u0ir0p

There is a general consensus that closing schools to control #COVID19 pandemic should be used as a last resort.

urls.title: COVID-19 in children and the role of school settings in transmission - second update
urls.description: The aim of this document is to provide an update on the knowledge surrounding the role of children in the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 and the role of schools in the COVID-19 pandemic, focusing in particular on the experience in EU/EEA countries since the beginning of the pandemic. This document also addresses transmission to and from staff in school settings, school-related mitigation measures including risk communication, testing, contact tracing, and the effectiveness and impacts of school closures.
